definition: to wield (political etc) power/be in power
palm of the hand/sole of the foot/paw/horseshoe/to slap/to hold in one's hand/to wield

sentences.english: In order to monopolize power, he does not hesitate to use every mean trick.
sentences.chinese: 爲了能夠掌權，他不惜使用各種卑劣手段。

sentences.english: Some government-controlled websites omitted it in reporting the speech.
sentences.chinese: 一些政府掌權的網站在報道這次講話時濾掉了這句話。

sentences.english: The accession of the Roman Church to power marked the beginning of the Dark Ages.
sentences.chinese: 在羅馬教開始掌權的時候，也就是黑暗世代的開始。

sentences.english: Erroneously or not, it was widely believed that she was the real boss of China.
sentences.chinese: 不論真假，許多人認爲她纔是當時中國真正的掌權者。

sentences.english: Such discretion allowed him to retain his standing as the Empire rose to power.
sentences.chinese: 謹言慎行使他在帝國掌權時保住了自己的地位。

sentences.english: Those who know the truth have been muzzled by those in power.
sentences.chinese: 那些瞭解真相的人爲掌權者所箝制。

sentences.english: He will come upon rulers as upon mortar, As the potter treads the clay.
sentences.chinese: 他必臨到掌權的，好像臨到灰泥，彷佛窯匠踹泥一樣。

sentences.english: He treads on rulers as if they were mortar, as if he were a potter treading the clay.
sentences.chinese: 他必臨到掌權的，好像臨到灰泥，彷佛窯匠踹泥一樣。

sentences.english: Absolute military power tends to deprave these which are not in control.
sentences.chinese: 軍事專權往往會使掌權的人道德敗壞。

sentences.english: He succeeded in worming himself into power.
sentences.chinese: 他成功地爬進了掌權階層。

sentences.english: Seems the princeling party is gonna come in power recently.
sentences.chinese: 看起來太子黨將於近期掌權。

sentences.english: Part of it was done by those in power - politicians, financiers and technological utopians.
sentences.chinese: 一部分是由那些掌權的政治家，金融家和技術烏托邦。

sentences.english: The victors, meanwhile, hung on to power long into their dotage.
sentences.chinese: 與此同時，勝利者則沉浸於長期的掌權之中。

sentences.english: But they say that Mrs. Smith wears the pants in the house.
sentences.chinese: 但是他們說史密斯太太當家掌權。

sentences.english: The risk of a vengeful takeover by the Sunni majority is too great.
sentences.chinese: 由遜尼多數派憤怒掌權，將會帶來極大風險。

definition: social movement/abbr. for 社會運動|社会运动
an execution/to put sb to death
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
